content.prompt: Bacterial cells that contain green fluorescent protein (GFP) will fluoresce under ultraviolet light. Which of the following is the most likely outcome of replacing the lacZ gene in the E. coli lac operon with the gene encoding GFP?

choices.label: Bacteria growing in the presence of lactose will fluoresce under ultraviolet light.
Beta-galactosidase will be made only when bacteria are cultured under ultraviolet light.
Ultraviolet light will cause a bond to form between glucose and galactose monomers.
Ultraviolet light will cause a duplication of the lac operon.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
